senses.sense_definition: The act of grasping or gripping something, especially with a hand or a tail.

examples.text: The robotic arm demonstrated excellent <w>prehension</w> when picking up the egg.
Some monkeys use their tails for <w>prehension</w> to hold onto branches.

senses.sense_definition: A philosophical concept, associated with Alfred North Whitehead, describing the way an entity perceives and incorporates aspects of other entities into its own existence.

examples.text: Whitehead's theory of <w>prehension</w> suggests that all entities are interconnected.
The student wrote a paper on the role of <w>prehension</w> in process philosophy.
